SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package model.records.npc

Class NPC

java.lang.Object
model.records.npc.Player
model.records.npc.NPC
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class NPC extends Player
NPC (Non-Player Character) class represents an automated player in the dice game. This class is responsible for handling the behavior of NPCs, such as rolling dice, simulating turns, making decisions based on different strategies, and calculating the optimal moves based on difficulty and other parameters.

The NPC uses a Monte Carlo simulation approach to simulate and evaluate different combinations of dice rolls. The class can adapt its behavior based on the difficulty level and performs actions accordingly.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • NPC

      public NPC(String name, DiceDeck diceDeck, int balance, int currentBet, int difficulty, Boolean integrity, int maxBet, int minBet, String description, String quote)
      Constructs an NPC player.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the NPC
      diceDeck - the dice deck used by the NPC
      balance - the initial balance of the NPC
      currentBet - the current bet amount of the NPC
      difficulty - the difficulty level of the NPC
      integrity - whether the NPC has integrity (honest play or not)
      maxBet - the maximum bet allowed for the NPC
      minBet - the minimum bet allowed for the NPC
      description - the description of the NPC
      quote - the quote associated with the NPC

      private Turn simulateBestTurn(List<Dice> availableDice, int depth)
      Simulates the best possible turn using a Monte Carlo approach by evaluating various dice combinations.
      Parameters:
      availableDice - the dice available to the NPC
      depth - the depth of the simulation
      Returns:
      the best possible turn

      depth - the depth of the simulation
      Returns:

      the timeout in seconds

      Returns:
      a busted turn

      combinations - the set of valid combinations to which new combinations will be added

      combinations - the set of valid combinations to which new combinations will be added

    • generateCombinations

      private Set<List<Dice>> generateCombinations(List<Dice> dice, int size)
      Generates all possible combinations of dice of a given size.
      Parameters:
      dice - the list of dice to generate combinations from
      size - the size of the combinations to generate
      Returns:
      a set of all possible combinations

    • generateCombinationsHelper

      private void generateCombinationsHelper(List<Dice> dice, int size, int start, List<Dice> current, Set<List<Dice>> result)
      Helper method to recursively generate all combinations of dice.
      Parameters:
      dice - the list of dice to generate combinations from
      size - the size of the combinations to generate
      start - the starting index for generating combinations
      current - the current combination being formed
      result - the set to store the valid combinations

    • simulateTurn

      private Turn simulateTurn(List<Dice> selected, List<Dice> remainingDice, int depth)
      Simulates a turn based on the selected dice and the remaining dice.
      Parameters:
      selected - the list of selected dice for the turn
      remainingDice - the list of remaining dice that have not been selected
      depth - the depth of the simulation
      Returns:
      the result of the simulated turn

    • simulateContinue

      private Turn simulateContinue(List<Dice> selected, List<Dice> remaining, int depth, int score, double risk)
      Simulates continuing the turn by selecting more dice and adding to the score.
      Parameters:
      selected - the list of selected dice for the turn
      remaining - the list of remaining dice
      depth - the depth of the simulation
      score - the current score
      risk - the calculated risk of continuing
      Returns:
      the simulated continued turn

    • selectOptimalTurn

      private Turn selectOptimalTurn(Turn passTurn, Turn continueTurn)
      Selects the optimal turn between two potential turns.
      Parameters:
      passTurn - the turn to be passed
      continueTurn - the turn to be continued
      Returns:
      the optimal turn

    • enhanceScore

      private double enhanceScore(Turn turn)
      Enhances the score of a given turn by factoring in several modifiers like the number of selected dice, risk penalties for busted turns, and the NPC's difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      turn - The turn whose score is to be enhanced.
      Returns:
      The enhanced score of the turn.

    • shouldContinue

      private boolean shouldContinue(int currentScore, int diceLeft, double risk)
      Determines whether the NPC should continue their turn based on the current score, remaining dice, and the calculated risk of continuing. The decision is influenced by the NPC's difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      currentScore - The current score accumulated by the NPC in the turn.
      diceLeft - The number of dice remaining in the current turn.
      risk - The calculated risk associated with continuing the turn.
      Returns:
      true if the NPC should continue the turn, false otherwise.

    • calculateRisk

      private double calculateRisk(int remainingDiceCount)
      Calculates the risk associated with continuing the current turn, based on the number of remaining dice. The risk increases as the number of remaining dice decreases. The NPC's difficulty level also influences the calculated risk.
      Parameters:
      remainingDiceCount - The number of dice remaining in the turn.
      Returns:
      A value representing the risk of continuing the turn, where higher values indicate greater risk.

    • applyTurnResult

      private void applyTurnResult(Turn turn)
      Applies the result of the turn by setting the lastTurn variable to the provided turn.
      Parameters:
      turn - The turn to be applied as the result.
